Issues.Title: fix(ivy): not applying camelCased style properties
Issues.Body:
Fixes Ivy not applying properties that are set in camelCase, because it goes through the `CSSStyleDeclaration` API via `setProperty` and `removeProperty` which requires for [the values to be in dash-case](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleDeclaration/setProperty).

**Note:** I opted to let the browser normalize the value, rather than convert it to dash-case during compile time, because there are some special cases like browser-prefixed properties where we might not normalize it in-line with the browser.

This PR fixes FW-579.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): not applying camelCased style properties" (#28276)

Issues.Title: build: hide vscode settings e.g. debug launch config
Issues.Body: `.vscode/launch.json` is used to be ignored because `.vscode` folder was ignored. PR #27781 changed this. Launch configs differ by platform and environment, so shouldn't be committed to the repo.

Issues.Title: Angular 6, brackets in DomSanitizer with div background
Issues.Body:
**Hello!**

DomSanitizer doesn't support url's with brackets, for example:

_/publishingimages/2018/11/29/2018_11_29_11_47_737_image%20(2).jpg_

**Solution to fix**: .replace("(", "%28").replace(")", "%29")

Issues.Title: WIP - test(docs-infra): do not wait for Angular in redirection e2e tests
Issues.Body:
In the redirection e2e tests, we mostly care about the URL, which does not depend on Angular (since it comes from the server-side). Thus, we do not need to wait for Angular on every navigation, which could also cause Protractor to fail when Angular could not be found on the redirected page (e.g. `/news` being redirected to blog.angular.io).

This commit disables waiting for Angular on navigation (for the redirection tests), but `waitForAngular()` can be manually called in a test, if needed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "WIP - test(docs-infra): do not wait for Angular in redirection e2e tests" (#28290)

Issues.Title: Memory leak while calling Renderer2.listen for parent elements
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
First time observed  in @angular 7.1.0, but reproducible in 7.2 as well

### Description

Lets say we have small application with root `<demo-app>` component and two routes which open `<first-component>` and `<second-component>` inside root one. `<first-component>` start listening for any root component event(`scroll` in example). The expected behavior is that after opening `<second-component>` the first one should be completely destroyed as far as all subscriptions are unsubscribed and listener dispose function was invoked as well. But actual behavior is that FirstComponent is still in the memory heap. If we switch between first and second component several times - several instances of FirstComponent are hanging in the heap that is memory leak, especially noticeable if component is huge.

On the screen below you can see that FirstComponent instance retains in memory because of DebugElement__PRE_R3__(corresponds to `demo-app`) still keeps listeners that added by Renderer2.listen before. And every listener keep reference to callback, and callback keeps reference to FirstComponent.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6919053/51522811-44578180-1e3b-11e9-9664-b734d16771fa.png)


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
<!--
Please create and share minimal reproduction of the issue starting with this template: https://stackblitz.com/fork/angular-issue-repro2
-->
Working example is available here:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-renderer-listen-for-parent

<!--
If StackBlitz is not suitable for reproduction of your issue, please create a minimal GitHub repository with the reproduction of the issue. Share the link to the repo below along with step-by-step instructions to reproduce the problem, as well as expected and actual behavior.

Issues that don't have enough info and can't be reproduced will be closed.

You can read more about issue submission guidelines here: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#-submitting-an-issue
-->

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
I've reproduced the bug in Angular@v7.* versions

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

The BrowserStack status badge is incorrect on the readme page


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
Go to https://github.com/angular/angular
Look at BrowserStack status badge. It says empty.

### What's the affected URL?**
https://github.com/angular/angular

## üì∑Screenshot
![screen shot 2019-01-22 at 2 34 15 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5382204/51524554-601b5180-1e54-11e9-8ab1-892da50de233.png)



## üî• Exception or Error
Upon clicking on status badge, it takes to https://www.browserstack.com/automate/public-build/LzF3RzBVVGt6VWE2S0hHaC9uYllOZz09LS1BVjNTclBKV0x4eVRlcjA4QVY1M0N3PT0=--eb4ce8c8dc2c1c5b2b5352d473ee12a73ac20e06

### Solution
I am from BrowserStack.

Each BrowserStack project has a unique badge key, which is used to get the status badge.
The project for which status badge is being shown is no longer getting used. 
The test cases are running in a different BrowserStack project.

Please generate a new status badge for the project.
Refer [this](https://www.browserstack.com/automate/status-badges) on how to generate the new status badge.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Incorrect BrowserStack status badge" (#28287)

Issues.Title: Automate releases and execute them on CI
Issues.Body:
Our releases are currently only half-automated.

The caretaker needs to follow release instructions and run various scripts or commands. This has two problems:
- caretaker's local dev environment might be corrupted or compromised
- the caretaker can make a mistake while following the instructions

The solution to these problems is to automate the releases and run them from CI.

This is how it could work:
1. caretaker prepares a release by
  - running the changelog script to update CHANGELOG.md
  - bumps the version in package.json
  - committing these changes to the release branch
  - tagging the commit
  - pushing the commit to the upstream branch
2. the CI triggers an upstream build
  - CI creates build artifacts and runs all the tests
  - as the last step in the CI workflow, we check and notices that this build was tagged, the CI will then pause and require [manual job approval from the caretaker](https://circleci.com/blog/manual-job-approval-and-scheduled-workflow-runs/) before publishing the build artifacts to npm
  - after manual approval, the CI proceeds to publish the build artifacts to npm

We could consider modifying this process, by automating even more of the first step, but that will require CI to create and push commits upstream. I suggest that we leave this enhancement as a follow up step, because it will require more security reviews and more complicated setup. We however did this on AngularJS a few years ago, so we already have expertise in how to set this up.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Automate releases and execute them on CI" (#28279)

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): don't create TNodes for native projectable nodes
Issues.Body:
Before this commit we were creating a "fake" TNode for each and every
projectable node passed during dynamic component creation. This approach
had several problems:
- the existing TView structure had to be mutated to accomodate new TNodes and
it was very easy to "corrupt" TView / TNode data structures;
- TNodes are not really needed to fully support projectable nodes so we were
creating objects and updating existing data structures for nothing.

This commit changes the approach so we don't create "fake" TNodes for projectable
nodes but instead we process projectable nodes directly in the projection instruction.
As a result we've got less code, less object allocation and - as a bonus - we fix few
bugs where TView / TNode data structures were corrupted when using projectable nodes.

**NOTE A REVIEWER**: there is still one remaining test marked with FW-873 - this is because the root cause is _different_ to the one fixed in this PR (LView / TView corruption by TNodes created for projectable nodes). I've investigated the other root cause and I know what is going on plus I _think_ I know how to fix it. But the fix is not trivial so it will be done in a separate PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(ivy): don't create TNodes for native projectable nodes" (#28275)

Issues.Title: fix(router): redirect to root url when returned as UrlTree from guard
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature

## What is the current behavior?
When returning the root url as UrlTree from a guard, to be [handled as a redirection](https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/4e9f2e58957b65d08ff97bbc6374673597c65fa5), the navigation is not processed. 

Issue Number: #27845

## What is the new behavior?
The redirection to the root url is properly processed.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

## Other information

The issue came from the error handler which incorrectly marked the router as already navigated *in any case*.
> [_line 706_](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/eea2b0f288eec889d56afb07dad21f75e77f1241/packages/router/src/router.ts#L706) `this.navigated = true;`

When the new navigation was handled afterwards, it would not be marked as to be processed. It was considered to be a navigation to the same path which had already been navigated to.

> [_line 463_](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/eea2b0f288eec889d56afb07dad21f75e77f1241/packages/router/src/router.ts#L463) `const urlTransition = !this.navigated ||
t.extractedUrl.toString() !== this.currentUrlTree.toString();`

It was working for urls other than root because a url comparison would mark the navigation as new, as seen above.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(router): redirect to root url when returned as UrlTree from guard" (#28271)

Issues.Title: Feature: Add a way to output lint result to a file
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [x ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
ng lint --format=json > issues.json
Worked previously as describe here:  [#4959](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/4959)
Worked for outputting results to json or any format.

In Angular 7 there was the addition of color to the output of lint results. This has broken the above workaround for outputting to a file.

what was previously like:
```
[
    {
        "endPosition": {
            "character": 144,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 361
        },
        "failure": "Exceeds maximum line length of 140",
        "name": "C:/myProject/src/app/modeling.component.ts",
        "ruleName": "max-line-length",
        "ruleSeverity": "ERROR",
        "startPosition": {
            "character": 0,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 217
        }
    }
]
```

is now like so

```
[37m[
    {
        "endPosition": {
            "character": 144,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 361
        },
        "failure": "Exceeds maximum line length of 140",
        "name": "C:/myProject/src/spp/modeling.component.ts",
        "ruleName": "max-line-length",
        "ruleSeverity": "ERROR",
        "startPosition": {
            "character": 0,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 217
        }
    }
][39m
```


### Solution I would like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> I would like an option added to ng lint to output to a file easily


### Workaround
"ng lint --format=json | sed -r \\"s/\\\x1B\\\[([0-9]{1,2}(;[0-9]{1,2})?)?[mGK]//g\\" > issues.json"
Which is ugly but works
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature: Add a way to output lint result to a file" (#13497)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): e2e test fails strict TS config
Issues.Body:
If using `strictFunctionTypes: true` in `tsconfig.json`, the default e2e test introduced in `7.3.0-beta.0` is failing compilation with:

```
error TS2345: Argument of type 'ObjectContaining<{ level: Level; }>' is not assignable to parameter of type 'Expected<Entry>'.
  Type 'ObjectContaining<{ level: Level; }>' is not assignable to type 'ObjectContaining<Entry>'.
    Type 'Partial<{ level: Level; }>' is not assignable to type 'Partial<Entry>'.
     Type '{ level: Level; }' is not assignable to type 'Entry'.
```

Explictely using `as logging.Entry` fixes the issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): e2e test fails strict TS config" (#13493)

Issues.Title: ng add options, other than --help, are not supported
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [x] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description The ng add command does not support listed options, other than '--help'. V6 of the CLI didn't support any options, beyond help, with add. After a little investigation into the code, it appears the add.json schema was updated to utilize the schematic definitions from definitions.json but it doesn't appear that add-impl.ts was fully updated to support them. From what I can tell, with my limited exploration into the code, add-impl.ts has hard-coded values for dryRun and force within the defined "runOptions" object. I am currently unaware of a package that utilizes interactive prompts so I could not validate if the defaults or interactive options are working or not but I do not see any additional interrogation of options object to look for them either. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ng new my-app --defaults cd my-app ng add --help ng add @angular/pwa --dry-run Since this package performs modifications, I would have expected to see a listing of those changes with the typical "dryRun" message. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: No warning given when using ES2017
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description Zone.js does not support native async/await (https://github.com/angular/zone.js/pull/1140) as present in ES2017. This means code that happens inside async/await blocks is invisible to zone.js thus not triggering change detection. Since this is a footgun for developer, Angular CLI should show a warning about this when ES2017 is set as the typescript target. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/angular/zone.js/pull/1140 ## üî• Exception or Error No error, just no change detection. ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI 7.x
**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: Build-optimizer fixes for FESM/ESM bundles
Issues.Body:
fix(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): prefix renamed classes
Module concatenation may rename classes with the same name. The renaming logic is specific to the bundler so we can't really foresee it.

But the fact remains that the inner function declaration doesn't need to have the same name as the outer one.

---

fix(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): identify relative imports in angular core

Build optimizer was broken for non-FESM files inside @angular/core because it couldn't identify relative imports were still inside core.

This change adds a known list of angular core files as a default, and also allows passing in a override.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Build-optimizer fixes for FESM/ESM bundles" (#13474)

Issues.Title: mat-table: null values shows 'null' in dynamic columns but '' in HTML declared columns
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
null values should show the same text in the cells (nothing = '') wether the column is created in typescript or in HTML

#### What is the current behavior?
When a column is declared in html, null values dont show anything in the cell
```HTML
<ng-container matColumnDef="AdresseOrigineVille">
	<mat-header-cell *matHeaderCellDef mat-sort-header>AdresseOrigineVille</mat-header-cell>
	<mat-cell *matCellDef="let item"> {{item.AdresseOrigineVille}} </mat-cell>
</ng-container>
```
But when the same column is declared in TypeScript, null values show 'null' in the cell
```HTML
<ng-container *ngFor="let column of columns" [matColumnDef]="column.columnDef">
	<mat-header-cell *matHeaderCellDef>{{ column.header }}</mat-header-cell>
	<mat-cell *matCellDef="let item">{{ column.cell(item) }}</mat-cell>
</ng-container>
```
```TypeScript
this.columns.push({ columnDef: "AdresseOrigineVille", header: "AdresseOrigineVille", cell: (item: (myInterface or any produces the same result))) => `${item.AdresseOrigineVille}` });
```
#### Version
Material 6.4.7

Regards,
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "mat-table: null values shows 'null' in dynamic columns but '' in HTML declared columns " (#14904)

Issues.Title: mat-select and mat-autocomplete options have different font sizes with custom typography
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
`mat-select` and `mat-autocomplete` options should have the same font size (and consequently same height), when a custom `$input` value is set via the `mat-typography-config()` function.

#### What is the current behavior?
When setting a custom `$input` value with the `mat-typography-config()`, `mat-select` options change their font-size accordingly, but the `mat-autocomplete` options ignore it, and use 16px instead (default).

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nzfhqa?file=theme-styles.scss
On `theme-styles.scss` file, try commenting line 4, to use theme default values, or switch the `mat-typography-level` function first argument to any another value (other than 16px), and observe the changes on the `mat-select` and `mat-autocomplete` options font size.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Currently testing on Angular 7.2.1 and Material 7.2.1.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-select and mat-autocomplete options have different font sizes with custom typography" (#14915)

Issues.Body:

Here is what I'm looking for in my table:

Username    | becky123
First Name  | becky
Last Name   | stewart

Notice that the headers are in 1 column instead of your typical row like I've seen in most of the Material table documentation (https://material.angular.io/components/table/overview).

Also the User object is basically the data source in the ts file (it's not an array since it's just a singular user.) Could someone please help me achieve this?

I've seen this How to display the table headers in a row, in angular material table? but this would be assuming that I have multiple users when I only have one stored in an object.

I really appreciate it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to display table headers in a column Angular material table" (#14914)

Issues.Title: build: allow recovering from failed publish script
Issues.Body:
* Currently if anything fails after the creating the local git tag, it's not possible to just re-run the release script because the script fails with an error saying that the local tag already exists. We can be smart about this and just use the existing tag if it refers to the expected SHA.
* Additionally if anything fails after pushing the release tag to the remote, it's not possible to re-run the release script because the tag exists remotely. We can be smart about this and just use the remote tag if it refers to the expected SHA.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: allow recovering from failed publish script" (#14906)

Issues.Title: refactor: add virtual scroll adapter
Issues.Body:
taking over for PR #14287 which has gone a while without updates. Includes changes to address comments

> As discussed in #10122

> In order to integrate virtual scroll into mat table we need to decouple CdkVirtualScrollViewport from CdkVirtualForOf

> This modification introduces an adapter between the 2 classes, so users can provide their own version of
~~CdkVirtualScrollAdapter~~ CdkVirtualScrollRepeater

> suggested by @shlomiassaf,
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: add virtual scroll adapter" (#14898)

Issues.Title: [Feature Request] CDK Resizable
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Add cdkResize (along with cdkResizeHandle) to the CDK to allow resizing of elements such as divs or any other element.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
I believe that it would complement the new drag and drop functionality very well and would be especially useful to those making dashboard like applications, such as myself.. 

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Should also probably have the similar events to the cdkDrag ones (startResizing, stopResizing, etc).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Feature Request] CDK Resizable" (#14897)

Issues.Title: fix(radio): underlying label not expanding to width of radio button
Issues.Body:
Fixes the `label` inside a `mat-radio-button` not expanding to the width of the radio button, reducing the clickable area.

Fixes #14894.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(radio): underlying label not expanding to width of radio button" (#14895)

Issues.Title: RadioButton not selected when clicking on the row (width: 100%)
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior? Clicking on the row should select the radio button when row width: 100%
Check the img below ![kapture 2019-01-20 at 12 13 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3479105/51437324-e9dcea80-1cad-11e9-942c-2a4e9dfc1022.gif) #### What is the current behavior? Clicking anywhere on the row does not select the radio button. However, it ads the class `cdk-focused` and `cdk-touch-focused` #### What are the steps to reproduce? Angular Material Docs: https://material.angular.io/components/radio/examples
#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? `7.2.1` #### Is there anything else we should know? Adding full width on the encapsulated label should do the job. I can add a PR if it's accepted.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "RadioButton not selected when clicking on the row (width: 100%)" (#14894)

Issues.Title: fix(stepper): unable to tab to step content
Issues.Body: Along the same line as #14808. Fixes not being able to reach the content of a step if it doesn't have focusable content already. Based on the [tabs example from the accessibility guidelines](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices-1.1/examples/tabs/tabs-2/tabs.html).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(stepper): unable to tab to step content" (#14892)

Issues.Title: cdkDrag : Reset all dragged element to initial position or specified position
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Feature Request

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
I am building Hotspot feature to an image. All the hotspots are set by the end user by dragging. I am able to build everything from cdkdrag but I need all Hotspot to reset to initial/custom position by a click of button.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
There is reset on cdkDragEnded. But how to apply this to button when all the hotspots are dragged.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "cdkDrag : Reset all dragged element to initial position or specified position" (#14890)

Issues.Title: [mat-icon] preventing content from translation
Issues.Body:
Current behavior: 

before translation | after translation
:---:|:---:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24639631/51412407-8bfcb580-1b7c-11e9-8d4c-9f1204b556b7.png) | ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24639631/51412741-aaaf7c00-1b7d-11e9-9921-060f8e28a337.png)

to prevent `mat-icon` content from translation by automated tools I'm adding `notranslate` class to `mat-icon` by default.

PS: I think it makes sense to use this class all the time and not only for font icons since even for svg icons there are only the following use cases:

1.  There is no text inside svg icon - so class will do no harm
2.  There is some text (e.g. one big letter as an icon) and it most likely shouldn't be translated
3.  It is highly unlikely to have a long text inside svg icon and to want it to be translated

This why I decided to have less conditions and add class to all icons by default.

From [Google Translate FAQ](https://cloud.google.com/translate/faq):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24639631/51423871-50430980-1bd7-11e9-9705-42ea24307b0f.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[mat-icon] preventing content from translation" (#14889)
